SEVIS_and_SEVP.description: Information related to the Student and Exchange Visitor Information System (SEVIS) and the Student and Exchange Visitor Program (SEVP).
subtopics: Record maintenance and updates in SEVIS

Student_Visas_and_Status.description: Details on U.S. nonimmigrant student visa types and maintenance of legal status.
subtopics: Change of Status procedures (e.g., B-2 to F-1)

Form_I-20.description: Comprehensive guidance on the Form I-20, 'Certificate of Eligibility for Nonimmigrant Student Status.'
subtopics: Use for applying for benefits (e.g., SSN, driver's license)
When to request a new/replacement Form I-20

Travel_and_Entry_Procedures.description: Guidance on entering the U.S., port of entry processes, and required documentation.
subtopics: Documents to carry (passport, visa, Form I-20)
Form I-94 (Arrival/Departure Record) – paper vs electronic
Reporting to school by program start date

Financial_Obligations.description: Information about mandatory and optional financial aspects of studying in the U.S.
subtopics: I-901 SEVIS Fee (who must pay, when, how via FMJfee.com)
Proof of payment for visa interviews and entry

Scholarships_and_Financial_Aid.description: List of external scholarship opportunities for international students.

Programs_of_Study.description: Overview of academic and training program options for international students.

Practical_Training_and_Employment.description: Work authorization options during and after studies.

Student_Life_Cycle_and_Compliance.description: End-to-end guidance for international students from acceptance to program completion.
subtopics: Transferring between schools (F-1 vs M-1 rules)

missing_or_incomplete_areas: Detailed cost of living estimates by region or city
Health insurance requirements and options for international students
Tax obligations and filing guidance (beyond ITIN mention)
Housing resources or on/off-campus living guidance
Cultural adjustment or mental health support resources
Accreditation vs SEVP certification distinction (often confused by students)
Detailed comparison of public vs private institution considerations
No clear guidance on part-time vs full-time enrollment exceptions
Limited information on appeal or reinstatement processes after status violations

suggested_schema.description: Recommended normalized JSON schema for building a student guidance knowledge base or FAQ system.
advantages: Decouples content from source format (markdown vs structured data)
Enables tagging and filtering by visa type, audience, or topic
Allows linking related topics (e.g., I-20 → SEVIS fee → visa application)
